subclassFeature.name: Shieldbearer
entries: 一个盾卫是一名多才多艺的战士，他们使用盾牌既用于防御又用于进攻。在战斗的混乱中，他们坚定地站在那里保护盟友，冲破敌军的阵线，或者用非凡的力量和准确性将盾牌投掷到空中。即使是最简单的木头或金属盾牌，在盾卫手中也变成了一种强大的武器。
如果一个特性需要进行豁免投骰（saving throw），你的：

subclassFeature.name: Counterstrike
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shieldbearer feature}
当敌人被他们自己的攻击分散注意力时，你可以发动强力一击。当距离你5英尺内的生物攻击你或你的盟友时，你可以使用你的反应用盾牌对他们进行一次近战攻击。命中时，该攻击额外造成一个伤害骰，并且目标在他们的下一个回合结束前进行的下一个攻击骰扔掷骰时具有劣势。
你可以使用这个特性的次数等于你的熟练加值，当你完成一次长休后，你会恢复所有使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: Shieldbash
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shieldbearer feature}
你可以像使用任何刀剑一样，用盾牌攻击你的敌人。你可以将你的盾牌作为一种简单的近战武器，造成打击伤害等于{@damage 1d8} + 你的力量调整值。你可以在你的回合中{@action Don or Doff a Shield|PHB|don or doff your shield}而不需要采取行动。
你的盾牌的伤害骰增加到7级时为{@damage 1d10}，到15级时为{@damage 1d12}。

subclassFeature.name: Shield Toss
entries: {@i 7th-level Shieldbearer feature}

你学会了以异常的力量和精准度投掷盾牌。对你来说，盾牌是一种带有投掷属性的武器，其正常射程为30英尺，最远射程为60英尺。命中时，它造成与使用你的{@subclassFeature Shieldbash|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|3|Ar20}特性进行近战攻击相同的伤害。如果你在这次远程攻击检定中投掷出20，目标将在他们的下一个回合结束前处于{@condition stunned}状态。如果攻击命中且你可以在本回合内进行另一次攻击，你可以使用下一次攻击将盾牌从第一个目标上弹开，瞄准原始目标周围10英尺内的另一个敌人，进行另一次远程攻击检定以确定是否命中。如果每次攻击都命中且你在本回合内还有攻击次数，你可以连续弹射盾牌多次。
回合结束时，你的盾牌会回到你身边。如果你有一只空手，你可以接住它；否则，它会落在你脚下。

subclassFeature.name: Improved Counterstrike
entries: {@i 10th-level Shieldbearer feature}

你的{@subclassFeature Counterstrike|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|3|Ar20}特性额外伤害增加到两个额外伤害骰子，而不是一个。此外，当你用你的{@subclassFeature Counterstrike|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|3|Ar20}特性击中一个生物时，他们在他们的下一个回合结束前所有攻击骰都有劣势（不只是一个）。

subclassFeature.name: Safeguard
entries: {@i 10th-level Shieldbearer feature}
在战斗的节奏中，你优雅地交织攻击和防御。当你持盾牌采取{@action Dodge}行动时，你可以进行一次近战攻击（无需行动），然后选择一个距离你5英尺以内的生物进行保护。直到你的下一个回合开始前，任何一个你能看见的生物对被保护生物进行的攻击骰有劣势。如果你被{@condition incapacitated}或者你离被保护生物超过5英尺，这个效果会提前结束。

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of the Brave
entries: {@i 15th-level Shieldbearer feature}
你强大的攻击控制着战场，击溃敌人的防御。每个回合一次，当你用盾牌击中一个生物时，你可以让其进行一次力量豁免检定。如果未通过豁免检定，你可以选择以下效果之一：

items: 如果目标是大型或更小，则将它们推开，使其离你远达10英尺。
目标随机掉落(%num%)个物品，这些物品掉落在他们的脚下。
在你的下一个回合开始之前对目标的下一次攻击有优势。

entries: 此外，由于您训练有素的反射能力，在您持盾时对您进行的远程武器攻击具有劣势。

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Guardian
entries: {@i 18th-level Shieldbearer feature}

你在战斗的热火中磨练了自己的技能，并最终获得了胜利。当你使用你的{@subclassFeature Safeguard|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|10|Ar20}特性来进行{@action Dodge}动作时，你可以在该动作中进行多达两次近战攻击（而不是一次）。此外，当你用你的{@subclassFeature Counterstrike|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|3|Ar20}特性击中一名生物时，它们必须成功进行一次体质豁免才能免疫{@condition stunned}，直到它们的下一个回合开始。

baseitem.name: Bladed Shield
entries: 这个盾牌的边缘装有锋利的弯刀。当你使用这个盾牌进行攻击时，你可以选择造成的伤害是钝击伤害还是割伤伤害。

baseitem.name: Buckler
entries: 虽然这个小圆盾提供的保护比较大型模型少，但它巧妙地掩盖了你的动作，以混淆你的敌人。当你挥舞这个盾牌时，你可以作为一个额外动作进行一次魅力检定（{@skill Deception}），与另一生物的感知检定（{@skill Insight}）进行对抗。如果成功，你在回合结束前对该生物进行的下一个攻击获得优势。

baseitem.name: Heraldic Shield
entries: 这面精美的盾牌上有一个象征着某个组织的纹章或家族徽章，比如骑士团或市民卫队，某个特定神的信仰，或者你的原籍地。当你明显地携带这个盾牌时，你在与展示的组织成员互动时进行魅力检定时获得优势。

baseitem.name: Lantern Shield
entries: 这个金属盾牌配备了一个可以挂在盾牌边缘钩上的{@item hooded lantern|PHB}，让你在保持一只手空闲的同时照亮你的道路。

baseitem.name: Spiked Shield
entries: 这个盾牌装备有强大的金属尖刺。一个试图{@action grapple|PHB}你的生物会受到{@damage 1d4}穿刺伤害，再加上每个他们的回合开始时受到额外{@damage 1d4}穿刺伤害，当{@action grapple|PHB|grappling}你。此外，使用这个盾牌进行的攻击在命中时会额外造成{@damage 1d4}穿刺伤害。

baseitem.name: Tower Shield
entries: 持有这个沉重的盾牌时，对你进行的远程武器攻击有劣势，但你不能将你的敏捷调整值加到你的护甲等级上，并且你在敏捷检定中有劣势（{@skill Stealth}）。

item.name: Arcanist's Shield Bracelet
entries: 这款舒适的钢质手铐手镯上刻有复杂的几何图案。
这个手镯有3个充能。作为一种反应，当你被攻击或被{@spell magic missile}法术瞄准时，你可以消耗1个充能获得+5的AC加值，包括对触发攻击的防御，并且你不会受到{@spell magic missile}的伤害。这个效果持续到你的下一个回合开始。
手镯在每天黎明时重新获得所有已消耗的充能。

item.name: Gem of Sending
entries: 这颗宝石上镶嵌着抄写员的符号。当你握着这颗宝石时，你可以使用一个动作从中施放{@spell sending}法术。目标是另一名携带发送宝石的生物。一旦通过宝石施放了{@spell sending}，宝石直到次日黎明前都无法再次使用。

magicvariant.name: +1 Shield (*)
entries: 持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得+1加值，使用这个盾牌进行的攻击和伤害骰投掷也获得+1加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的。
持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得额外{=bonusAc}加值，使用这个盾牌进行攻击和伤害骰投掷时获得额外{=bonusWeapon}加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的。

magicvariant.name: +2 Shield (*)
entries: 持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得+2加值，使用这个盾牌进行攻击和伤害骰投掷时也获得+2加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的额外加值。
持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得额外{=bonusAc}加值，使用这个盾牌进行攻击和伤害骰投掷时获得额外{=bonusWeapon}加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的。

magicvariant.name: +3 Shield (*)
entries: 持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得+3加值，使用这个盾牌进行攻击和伤害骰投掷时也获得+3加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的额外加值。
持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得额外{=bonusAc}加值，使用这个盾牌进行攻击和伤害骰投掷时获得额外{=bonusWeapon}加值。这个加值是在盾牌正常AC加值之外的。
这个纤薄的圆形盾牌设计用于轻松投掷。你可以将这个盾牌作为一种带有投掷特性的简单近战武器使用，其正常射程为40英尺，最远射程为60英尺。命中时，它造成{@damage 1d8} + 你的力量调整值的钝击伤害和{@damage 1d6}力量伤害。
无论命中与否，盾牌都会在你使用它进行攻击后或者在你的回合结束时（你选择）回到你手中。如果你有一只空手，你可以接住盾牌；否则，它会掉落在你脚下。
这个简单的椭圆形盾牌通常由硬化皮革或抛光木制成，已经被一位牧师或圣骑士祝福过。你可以使用这个盾牌来执行以下其中一个10分钟的仪式，可以独自进行，也可以与其他生物一起进行：

entries.name: Valor
entries: 在接下来的一个小时里，参与仪式的最多六个生物在豁免被{@condition frightened}影响时获得优势。

entries.name: Honor
entries: 你触摸了一个参与了庆祝仪式的生物。在接下来的24小时内，当这个生物进行能力检定时，他们可以额外添加一个奖励，该奖励等于其他参与仪式并希望尊敬他们事迹的生物数量（最多+10）(%num%)。

entries.name: Clarity
entries: 你触摸参与仪式的生物，并结束影响它们的一个状态。
一旦这个盾牌的特性被使用，直到第二天黎明之前都无法再次使用。
这坚固的盾牌镶嵌着类似羊角的图案。使用这个盾牌可以让你在试图破门、破拦、或者破坏类似障碍物的力量检定中获得优势。此外，当你用这个盾牌成功攻击一个生物时，你可以选择将目标击退10英尺，而不是5英尺。
这个圆盾的边缘镶嵌着精美的设计，展示了月相的变化。这个盾牌与你战役设定中的一个月亮相关联，随着那个月亮进入不同的月相，相应的设计会微微发光。
持有这个盾牌时，你的AC获得+1的加值。此外，这个盾牌根据当前的月相有不同的属性：

entries.name: New Moon
entries: 你可以随意施放{@spell darkness}法术，以盾牌为中心。当你以这种方式施放法术时，魔法黑暗不会影响你的视觉。此外，你可以使用一个奖励动作变成{@condition invisible}，连同你身上穿戴的任何物品，持续1分钟。
一旦你使用了这个盾牌的属性，你就不能再次使用它，直到下一个新月的夜晚。

entries.name: Waxing Moon
entries: 你可以随意施放{@spell faerie fire}（豁免{@dc 17}）。此外，你可以使用一个奖励动作选择你周围30英尺内的最多三个生物。在接下来的一分钟内，每个生物都被赋予月之力量，可以在攻击检定、豁免检定和伤害检定中增加{@dice 1d4}（这额外的伤害是辐射伤害）。一旦你使用了盾牌的这个特性，直到第二天黎明之前你不能再次使用它。

entries.name: Full Moon
entries: 你可以随意施放{@spell see invisibility}法术。此外，你可以使用一个动作，在距离你120英尺内的某点上召唤月光辉煌，覆盖20英尺半径范围。该区域内你选择的每个生物必须进行{@dc 17}体质豁免才能，未通过则受到{@damage 8d6}辐射伤害，通过则只受到一半伤害。一旦你使用了这个盾牌的属性，直到下一个满月之夜之前你不能再次使用它。

entries.name: Waning Moon
entries: 你可以随意施放{@spell pass without trace}，无需材料。此外，你可以使用一个奖励动作选择你30英尺内的一名生物。在接下来的一分钟内，该生物必须从他们的攻击检定、豁免检定和伤害骰中减去{@dice 1d4}。一旦你使用了这个盾牌的属性，直到次日黄昏前你不能再次使用它。

entries.name: Eclipse
entries: 在罕见的月食事件中，你的护盾将在月食持续期间获得以下属性，而不是当前月相的属性。你可以随意施放{@spell sanctuary}（豁免{@dc 17}）。此外，你可以使用一个动作选择你周围60英尺内的最多六个生物。每个生物必须通过一次{@dc 17} 体质豁免才能在10分钟内被{@condition blinded}。在他们的回合结束时，目标可以进行一次体质豁免，成功则结束自身的状态。一旦你使用了护盾的这个属性，你在月食持续期间无法再次使用它。

entries.name: Moon Phases
entries: 在你的设定中追踪月相可能会很有趣，特别是如果你的角色与月亮或月亮有联系。但如果你和你的GM不想处理这些细枝末节，你的GM可以通过选择当前月相或掷骰子{@dice d12}来确定移动月之盾的当前属性。掷骰结果为1时，月亮是新月；2-6时，月亮在逐渐圆满；7-11时，月亮在逐渐缩小；12时，月亮是满月。GM可以选择日食发生的时间和情况。

这个盾牌被抛光得像镜子一样闪亮，但其表面显示出七彩闪烁，而不是任何倒影。这个盾牌有10个充能。当你握持它时，当你被针对远程法术攻击或处于以直线为范围的法术影响范围内时，你可以使用你的反应并消耗与法术等级相等的充能数量（最少1个）来反射该法术。当你这样做时，该法术对你没有任何影响，并且其效果被反射，就好像它是源自于你一样。你可以选择无害地反射该法术，或者你可以选择在范围内选择一个生物（对于远程法术攻击）或者选择一个方向反射该法术（对于范围影响）。
盾牌在每天黎明时恢复{@dice 1d6 + 4}次充能。

entries.name: Cumbersome
entries: 一个带有笨重属性的盾牌，无论其持有者的职业特性或其他能力如何，都无法有效地投掷。

entriesTemplate.name: Strength Required
entries: 这个盾牌不能被力量分数低于{{item.strength}的生物使用。

monster.name: Auto-Sentinel

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of their creator but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
entries: 哨兵可以指定另一个生物作为他们的守护对象。当一个生物在离哨兵5英尺范围内用攻击命中了哨兵的守护对象，而哨兵不是{@condition incapacitated}时，哨兵可以立即对那个生物进行一次近战攻击（无需动作）。
哨兵只能同时拥有一个充能。

trait.name: Siege Engine
entries: 哨兵对物体和结构造成双倍伤害。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 哨兵进行三次气动拳击。他们可以用抓手攻击或使用卷绕来替换其中一次攻击。

action.name: Pneumatic Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9}攻击，达到5英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) 钝击伤害，并且目标必须成功进行一次{@dc 17} 力量豁免才能不被击倒{@condition prone}。

action.name: Grapple-Hand
entries: {@atk mw} 使用近战攻击，达到50英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) 钝击伤害，并且目标被{@condition grappled} (逃脱 {@dc 17})。直到这次擒抱结束，目标被{@condition restrained} 并且在力量检定和豁免骰上有劣势，而且哨兵不能用同一只手攻击或{@action grapple} 另一个目标。哨兵有两只手。

action.name: Reel
entries: 哨兵将其擒抱的每个生物朝自己拉拽25英尺。

action.name: Beeline
entries: 哨兵沿直线向其目标移动，移动距离为其速度。在此移动过程中，哨兵无视艰难地形，可以穿过敌对生物的空间，无论其大小，并且可以冲破路径上不超过1英尺厚的小型非魔法障碍物，如门、窗户或墙壁。每个{@condition prone}生物的空间，哨兵移动时都会受到44({@damage 8d10}) 钝击伤害。每个不是{@condition prone}的生物的空间，哨兵移动时必须进行一个{@dc 17} 敏捷豁免检定。未能通过豁免检定的生物会受到16({@damage 2d10 + 5}) 钝击伤害，并被推开5英尺，进入其选择的未被占据的空间，或者如果范围内没有未被占据的空间，则被撞倒在其当前空间内。通过豁免检定的生物只会受到一半伤害，并且不会被推开或撞倒{@condition prone}。

reaction.name: Life and Limb
entries: 当哨兵在与他们的守护目标之间距离在5英尺以内，并且哨兵能看见的一只生物攻击了守护目标时，哨兵可以与守护目标交换位置，成为攻击的目标。

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: 牧师施放以下其中一个法术，使用魅力作为施法能力（法术豁免 {@dc 16}）：

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 牧师进行三次爪击攻击，然后进行火球攻击或施法。

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} 进行攻击，射程5英尺，目标一个。造成{@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) 斩击伤害加上9 ({@damage 2d8}) 火焰伤害。

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} 命中，射程120英尺，一个目标。 {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) 火焰伤害。被此法术击中的易燃物品，如果没有被穿戴或携带，将会点燃。

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: 牧师在一个30英尺的锥形范围内呼出火焰。该区域内的每个生物必须进行一次{@dc 16} 敏捷豁免检定，未通过则受到42({@damage 12d6}) 火焰伤害，通过则减半。此外，如果生物受到或本应受到此次行动的伤害，它们将失去对火焰伤害的任何抗性或免疫，持续1分钟。

variant.name: Color
entries: 龙祭司的属性块假定龙祭司的主人是一只红龙，这体现在它对火焰伤害的免疫性以及其行动造成的火焰伤害上。你可以通过更改伤害类型来适应其他类型的龙。

items.name: {{damageTypeU}} Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: 牧师在一个30英尺锥形范围内呼出{{damageType}。该区域内的每个生物必须进行一次{@dc 16} 敏捷豁免检定，未通过则受到42({@damage 12d6}) {{damageType} 伤害，通过则减半。此外，如果生物受到或本应受到此次行动造成的伤害，它们将失去对{{damageType} 伤害的任何抗性或免疫，持续1分钟。

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}攻击，达到5英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4})点砍伤伤害加上9 ({@damage 2d8})点{{damageType}}伤害。

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: 如果猎魔人受到一种效果的影响，使他们可以进行豁免才能仅受到一半伤害，那么如果他们成功通过豁免检定，他们将不受任何伤害，如果他们未能通过，则只受到一半伤害。

trait.name: Dragonsbane
entries: 当猎魔人的行动或能力涉及到龙类生物时，它包括具有龙族血统的生物，比如{@creature dragon priest|Ar20|dragon priests}，龙裔，{@class Sorcerer|PHB|Draconic Bloodline|Draconic|PHB}巫师，和龙人。

trait.name: Underdog
entries: 猎魔人可以与任何大小的生物搏斗，并且在进行力量（{@skill Athletics}）或敏捷（{@skill Acrobatics}）检定以{@action grapple}或攀爬到比自己体型更大的生物时具有优势。当与比自己体型更大的生物搏斗或紧贴时，猎魔人对该生物进行的攻击投掷获得优势。如果猎魔人搏斗的生物至少比猎魔人大两个体型，猎魔人的速度变为0，而非目标的速度，并且如果被猎魔人这种方式搏斗的生物移动，猎魔人将随之移动，不消耗猎魔人的任何移动。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 这位杀手进行三次攻击。

action.name: Battleaxe of Dragon Slaying
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}攻击（或{@hit 10}对抗龙族）, 射程5英尺, 一个目标. 造成{@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) 斩击伤害, 或者如果双手使用则为9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) 斩击伤害. 如果目标是一只龙族, 额外受到10 ({@damage 3d6}) 斩击伤害.

action.name: Javelin of Dragon Slaying
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8}攻击（或者{@hit 10}攻击龙族）, 射程30/120尺，目标一个。造成{@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) 点穿刺伤害。如果目标是一只龙族，它们必须进行一次{@dc 17}体质豁免，未通过则额外受到33 ({@damage 6d10}) 点穿刺伤害，通过则减半。
这位杀手携带着四支标枪。一旦一支龙杀标枪对龙造成额外伤害，它就会变成一支非魔法标枪。

action.name: Wings of Flying (2/Day)
entries: 杀手将他们的斗篷变成一双翅膀，获得60英尺的飞行速度，持续1小时。

reaction.name: Sudden Strike (3/Day)
entries: 当猎杀者能看见的生物在距离猎杀者30英尺内移动时，猎杀者可以对该生物进行一次武器攻击。如果攻击命中，目标的速度将减半，直到当前回合结束。

spellcasting.name: Signcasting
headerEntries: 这位战法施放以下其中一个法术，无需材料或口头组件，并使用智力作为施法能力（法术豁免 {@dc 16}，用法术攻击命中 {@hit 8}）：

trait.name: Bodymind Trance
entries: 这位战法在维持法术的{@status concentration}时，对体质豁免 throws 有优势，并且免疫任何让其他生物感知他们情绪或读取他们思维的效果，以及任何他们拒绝的占卜法术。如果这位战法受到精神伤害，这个特性在战法的下一个回合开始前不起作用。

trait.name: {@link Swordkeeper|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JLzYAteddO0}
entries: 如果战法师挥舞一把剑，他们的武器攻击是魔法的，并且在攻击和伤害骰上获得+1的奖励（已包含在攻击中）。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 这个战法士进行两次长剑或奥术射线(Eldritch Blast)攻击，并且使用符文施法(Signcasting)。

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} 近战攻击，射程5英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5})点割伤伤害。

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} 使用 {@hit 8} 进行攻击，射程120英尺，目标为一名敌人。造成{@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) 点力场伤害。

bonus.name: Witch Step
entries: 战法师使用魔法传送，连同他们穿戴或携带的任何装备一起，最多可传送至45英尺内一个可以看见的未被占据的空间。

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: 当格施(Gish)受到攻击或被{@spell magic missile}法术瞄准时，会出现一道{@condition invisible}魔法力场屏障保护他们。
直到他们的下一个回合开始，格施获得+5点AC加值，包括对触发攻击的防御，并且格施对{@spell magic missile}不会受到伤害。

trait.name: Action Surge (3/Day)
entries: 英雄在他们的回合中可以额外执行一次动作。

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: 英雄在先攻骰时具有优势，并且不会被吓到。

trait.name: Impossible Arm
entries: 英雄可以单手使用双手武器。如果武器具有多用途属性，英雄始终使用双手的伤害骰(%num%)。

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: 英雄的武器攻击是魔法的。

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: 英雄对物体和建筑造成双倍伤害。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 英雄进行了两次重槌（Maul）攻击，并使用了压倒性一击（Overwhelming Attack）。

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} 近战攻击，射程5英尺，目标一个。{@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) 钝击伤害。

action.name: Overwhelming Attack
entries: 英雄进行一次重槌攻击，目标是英雄周围5英尺内的任意数量生物，并对每个目标使用相同的攻击骰。英雄对每个被攻击命中的目标额外造成21({@damage 6d6})点钝击伤害。

action.name: Supersonic Yawp
entries: 英雄在一个60英尺锥形范围内发出震耳欲聋的战斗呐喊。在该区域内能听到英雄声音的每个生物必须进行一次{@dc 18}体质豁免投。未通过豁免的生物会受到27点({@damage 4d10 + 5}) 雷属性伤害，并在1分钟内处于{@condition deafened}状态。通过豁免的生物只会受到一半伤害，并且不会被{@condition deafened}。由石头、水晶或金属等无机材料构成的生物在这次豁免投中有劣势。

action.name: Seismic Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: 英雄用一颗陨石坠落的力量跺脚。站在英雄周围30英尺范围内的每个生物受到26({@damage 6d6 + 5}) 钝击伤害，并必须通过一次{@dc 18} 敏捷豁免检定，否则被击倒{@condition prone}。

bonus.name: Barbaric Leap
entries: 英雄可以向任何方向跳高达20英尺，并且可以降落在另一个生物的空间内。如果他们降落在另一个生物的空间内，那个生物会受到12点打击伤害，并被推开5英尺，移动到该生物选择的一个未被占据的空间，或者如果范围内没有未被占据的空间，则在其当前位置被击倒。此外，英雄在其回合结束前对于降落空间内的生物攻击具有优势。

bonus.name: Hidden Strength (1/Day)
entries: 英雄恢复了57 ({@dice 6d8 + 30}) 点生命值。

reaction.name: Think Again
entries: 当英雄被120英尺内可见的生物的非致命打击攻击时，英雄可以使用{@link catch the weapon with their bare hands|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nprJvYKz3QQ}，使攻击失效。如果武器非魔法，则会被摧毁。

spellcasting.name: Spell Scrolls
headerEntries: 多才多艺者从{@item spell scroll}中施放以下法术之一（法术豁免{@dc 18}）。施放完法术后，卷轴会被摧毁，多才多艺者无法再次施放该法术。

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: 如果多才多艺者受到影响，使其可以进行豁免才能仅受一半伤害，那么如果他们在豁免检定中成功，他们将不受伤害，如果失败则只受一半伤害。

trait.name: Calculated Defense
entries: 当博学者没有穿戴轻甲或无甲，并且没有使用盾牌时，他们的AC包括他们的智力调整值。

trait.name: Genius Intellect
entries: 这位博学多才者总是能够在本土位面上准确知晓时间和位置，能够回忆起所学的任何信息，并能够立即在脑海中完成数学计算。

trait.name: Practiced Hand
entries: 多才多艺者可以使用他们的智力调整值，而不是力量或敏捷，来进行武器的攻击和伤害骰。

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: 多才多艺者在使用武器攻击命中目标并且具有优势攻击骰时，额外造成17点伤害({@damage 5d6})，或者当目标在多才多艺者的非{@condition incapacitated}盟友5英尺范围内且多才多艺者没有攻击骰劣势时，也会造成额外伤害。

trait.name: Switched On
entries: 这位博学多才的人总是能够辨别出幻觉，但在与幻觉互动之前无法看穿这个影像。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 这位博学多才者进行三次武器攻击。

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw}进行攻击，达到5英尺，一个目标。造成10({@damage 1d8 + 6})点刺伤伤害加上28({@damage 8d6})点毒素伤害，目标必须成功通过一次{@dc 18}体质豁免才能避免在他们的下一个回合结束前成为{@condition poisoned}。

action.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12}攻击，射程5英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) 钝击伤害，并且目标必须成功通过一次{@dc 18} 体质豁免才能在变形者的下一个回合结束前不动。

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw}进行攻击，射程30/120英尺，目标为一名生物。造成{@h}9({@damage 1d6 + 6})点穿刺伤害加上28({@damage 8d6})点毒素伤害，并且目标必须通过一次{@dc 18}体质豁免才能避免在接下来的回合结束前变为{@condition poisoned}。

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: 多才多艺者执行{@action Dash}、{@action Disengage}或{@action Hide}动作。

bonus.name: Stillness of Mind
entries: 这位博学多才者结束了一个让他们处于{@condition charmed}或{@condition frightened}状态的效果。

reaction.name: Repartee
entries: 多才多艺者在被一次将会击中他们的武器攻击时，可以对他们的盔甲类别（AC）增加+4。为此，多才多艺者必须看见攻击者并且握持一把近战武器。多才多艺者随后可以对攻击者进行一次武器攻击。

monster.name: Saint

trait.name: Celestial Resurrection
entries: 一个被摧毁的圣徒在{@dice 1d10}天内获得一个新的身体，恢复所有生命值并重新活跃起来。新的身体出现在被圣徒的神灵视为神圣的地面上，比如祭坛、神龛或寺庙。

trait.name: Cone of Awe
entries: 这位圣者的凝视形成一个150英尺的锥形区域，让凡人感到震惊、恐惧和惊叹。在他们每个回合开始时，圣者决定锥形区域的朝向和是否激活。任何在该锥形区域内开始回合的生物必须通过一次{@dc 20}魅力豁免才能避免受到14({@damage 4d6})点辐射伤害，并在1分钟内成为{@condition frightened}的圣者。一名{@condition frightened}生物可以在每个回合开始时重复进行豁免才能，成功则结束对自己的影响。

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: 圣者知道他们是否听到了谎言。

trait.name: Eternal Resistance
entries: 圣徒在面对法术和其他魔法效果的豁免检定时具有优势。此外，如果圣徒未能通过一次豁免检定，他们可以选择毁掉一件他们的神圣武器（如果有的话），并取得成功。

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 圣徒进行两次攻击，并使用烈焰之雨(Flaming Rain)。

action.name: Inflict Wounds (5th-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk ms} 近战攻击，达到5英尺，一个目标。造成{@h}38 ({@damage 7d10})点死灵伤害。

action.name: Flaming Rain
entries: 圣者可以看到的最多三个生物身上会降下火焰般的光辉雷电。目标必须通过一次 {@dc 23} 敏捷豁免才能避免受到18点 ({@damage 4d8}) 辐射伤害。
目标在这次豁免投掷中不受掩护的益处影响。

action.name: Plane Shift (7th-Level Spell)
entries: 圣徒施放{@spell plane shift}法术，使用魅力作为施法能力（法术豁免{@dc 23}， 命中加值{@hit 15}）。

action.name: Heal (3/Day; 8th-Level Spell)
entries: 圣者能看到的60英尺内的一只生物恢复90点生命值。这个法术也会结束{@condition blinded|PHB|blindness}，{@condition deafened|PHB|deafness}，以及影响目标的任何疾病。这个法术对构造体或不死生物无效。

bonus.name: Hallowed Weapons (1/Day)
entries: 圣者在距离自己60英尺的三个不同点创造三把漂浮的幽灵武器。这些武器可以采取圣者选择的任何形态。这些武器持续1分钟。武器的攻击范围为5英尺，每个武器可以在不使用圣者的反应的情况下每回合进行一次攻击。

When the weapons are first created, they can each make a melee spell attack ({@hit 15} bonus to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes 21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) force damage.
As a bonus action on later turns, the saint can move each weapon up to 30 feet and make one attack with it against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon.

legendaryHeader: The saint has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: 1. Fiery Translocation
entries: The saint magically teleports, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. Each creature within 15 feet of the space the saint entered must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: 2. Shackles of Judgment
entries: Glowing chains appear from beneath up to five creatures the saint can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled} by the chains (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, a target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The chains have AC 20, 10 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

legendary.name: 3. Word of Unmaking
entries: A beam of bright light erupts from the mouth of the saint toward one target they can see within 60 feet of them. The target can be a creature, object, or creation of magical force, such as the wall created by {@spell wall of force}.

A creature targeted by this action must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 106 ({@damage 19d6 + 40}) force damage and becomes {@condition frightened} of the saint and {@condition deafened} until they finish a short or long rest. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves them with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a {@spell true resurrection} or a {@spell wish} spell.
This ability automatically disintegrates a Huge or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force.
If the target is a Gargantuan object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 20-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.

trait.name: Signature Attack: Shieldbash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Beginning at 7th level, the shieldbearer can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the {@action Attack} action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level (3/Day): Smash 'n' Bash
entries: The shieldbearer makes a signature attack. On a hit, the next attack against the target has advantage.

action.name: 5th Level (3/Day): Safeguard
entries: The shieldbearer makes a signature attack and assumes a defensive stance. Attack rolls against the shieldbearer and one creature of their choice within 5 feet of them are made with disadvantage until the start of the shieldbearer's next turn.

action.name: 7th Level (3/Day): Throw Shield
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 ft., one or two targets. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The shield returns to the shieldbearer at the end of their turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Librarian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 22}):

trait.name: Celestial Weapons
entries: The Librarian's weapon attacks are magical. When the Librarian hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Librarian fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Librarian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Protective Prison
entries: The Librarian can't leave the Vault by any means unless the gods that created the Vault end her imprisonment.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Librarian regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and is in the Vault.

trait.name: Renewed
entries: If the Librarian is destroyed, the Vault's magical operations cease for {@dice 1d10} days. At the end of this time, the Librarian reforms in the Vault, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Librarian makes two Tome Smack attacks and one Tsk, Tsk, Tsk attack.

action.name: Tome Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Tsk, Tsk, Tsk
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or be unable to make ranged attacks or cast spells other than cantrips for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

action.name: This Needs Work {@recharge 5}
entries: The Librarian pulls a lifebook and a feather quill from the air, then rewrites the fates of those who dare attack her. All creatures of the Librarian's choice within 60 feet of her must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 32 ({@damage 5d12}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the Librarian's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

bonus.name: Quick Edits
entries: The Librarian pulls a pencil from her hair and writes in the air, summoning a distracting, illusory object within 5 feet of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target has disadvantage on the next attack roll they make before the start of the Librarian's next turn, whereupon the object disappears.

reaction.name: Choose My Own Path
entries: When the Librarian is targeted by an attack, she can step into one lifebook within 5 feet of her and emerge from a second lifebook within 120 feet of her, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second lifebook, potentially causing the attack to miss if the Librarian is out of range of the attack.

legendary.name: Cloud of Pages
entries: The Librarian calls books from the shelves and stacks around her, filling the air with whirling tomes and pages in a 5-foot-radius, 20-foothigh column centered on a point within 120 feet of her. A creature except for the Librarian takes 15 ({@damage 6d4}) slashing damage when they enter that area for the first time on a turn or start their turn there. The books fall to the ground at the start of the Librarian's next turn.

legendary.name: Pen Is Mightier
entries: The Librarian makes a Tome Smack attack.

legendary.name: Shhh!
entries: The Librarian casts the {@spell silence} spell.

bonus.name: Channel Vault (2/Day)
entries: The writer touches another creature. The target regains 15 ({@dice 3d8 + 2}) hit points or is freed from any curse, disease, poison, {@condition blinded|PHB|blindness}, or {@condition deafened|PHB|deafness}.

monsterFluff.name: Auto-Sentinel
entries: Typically made of magically animated stone, iron, or brass, these constructs are created to defend others. Constructs designed as personal security already exist in the game, but those are monsters, and this is an NPC!

This stat block can serve as a powered-up version of the {@creature bodyguard|Ar18}{@sup {@cite Arcadia 18|Ar20|1}}, but it also captures the essence of {@link a type of character that I love to run|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gz-yTQYZW6w}. Players tend to fall in love with protective sidekick robots that can't speak, but who are clearly sapient and have a sweet personality wholly at odds with their incredible strength. It's niche, but effective!

monsterFluff.name: Debut Bronzeband
entries: As the Writer of the Fallen Eye, Debut Bronzeband is always the first with a plan.

Debut grew up on the streets committing petty theft. His brilliant mind for elaborate schemes led to masterful heists, and city officials overlooked his crimes in exchange for consultation on other cases. Finally, his brazen daylight theft of the memorial statue of local hero Tohmas "the Ashen Hound" got him thrown in prison. His arrest shook his confidence, and he spent the next few years formulating and scrapping brilliant escape plans. The Ashen Hound was a hero the Scribes had a hand in creating, causing the Librarian to ask the Scribes to free and recruit Debut.
When the characters first encounter Debut, read or paraphrase the following:

A bedraggled young gnome has a dozen chewed pencils jutting out of the pockets of his well-tailored, rust-colored jacket. His shoulders are already hunched despite his youth, evident from the patchy beard he tried to shape into a distinguished point.

items.name: Overview
entries: An introverted perfectionist and scheming mastermind

items.name: Phrase
entries: "You've got one shot to get it right."

items.name: Traits
entries: Analytical, egotistical, risk-averse

items.name: Motivation
entries: Although he feels indebted to the Scribes and masterfully manages their day-to-day operations, Debut intends to one day start his own story away from the organization—if he could only perfect his plan for the future.

monsterFluff.name: Dragon Priest
entries: Ancient dragons are so suffused with magic that they can impart a fraction of their power to their most loyal pawns. The dragon priest is one such servant—a cultist dedicated to the will of a powerful dragon, partially transformed by their patron into a quasi-draconic figure. The ancient dragon bestows "gifts" upon the priest that typically take the form of sharpened claws, filed teeth, reptilian eyes, and patches of diamond-hard scale.
I wield the very flame of Corzivax-Baloroth! Her power is mine!

monsterFluff.name: Dragon Slayer
entries: The inverse of a {@creature dragon priest|Ar20}, the dragon slayer is a powerful martial NPC that hunts and destroys great wyrms. Typically, this makes them heroes, but it depends on which dragons they slay. Your players might run afoul of a dragon slayer by protecting a good dragon or by stealing the glory of killing a dragon from a particularly prideful dragon slayer.

monsterFluff.name: Gish
entries: The gish is a character with equal skill in martial might and arcane magic. The word gish comes from a certain group of creatures that shall not (legally) be named from a book published in 1980, but it has come to mean any eldritch-knight-type, sword-wielding spell-slinger. A spellsword!
I think that gish should be tough as nails—the perfect combatant, with few, if any, weaknesses—so that's what you've got here!

The gish begins combat by casting {@spell eldritch blast} or {@spell fireball} to soften up the characters from a distance while piling on buffs for a few turns, like the {@spell fire shield} and {@spell haste} spells. After that, the gish can easily move into melee range with Witch Step and switch to attacking with their {@item longsword|PHB}. When reduced to half their hit point maximum (97), they start using the {@spell vampiric touch} spell each round to regain some vitality. When the gish is reduced to 49 hit points, they use Witch Step to escape or they surrender.

monsterFluff.name: Hero
entries: Heroes are fun to use as NPCs when your characters have become frighteningly powerful themselves! You can use this stat block to represent legendary NPCs in your world, on par with figures like {@link Conan the Barbarian|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5K3AKl5qpc} or {@link Xena: Warrior Princess|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9UY1V66E8I}, or demigods like Hercules and Gilgamesh.

The party might clash with a hero if they have a reputation for morally questionable decisions or if they've been set up! Or maybe the hero has fallen victim to the duplicitous mind control of a cunning villain? In any case, I wish your players luck if they wind up as an obstacle in the hero's way.

monsterFluff.name: Polymath
entries: The polymath knows just about everything. These NPCs are geniuses who rely on the breadth and depth of their smarts instead of the strength of their sword arm. They're so intelligent there's probably only one polymath on a planet. Maybe two ... and those two are probably rivals.
A polymath almost always knows when they have enemies coming, and given time to prepare, they set traps throughout the battlefield, whether in their lair or not.

entries.name: A Polymath's Lair
entries: Most polymaths build a stronghold—a secret laboratory, a floating airship, or a forgotten island. The only common thread is that the polymath likes to keep their lair hidden so they can store the knowledge they have amassed without drawing attention.
A polymath encountered in their lair has a challenge rating of 19 (22,000 XP).

monsterFluff.name: Saint
entries: When a mortal dies in service to their deity, they sometimes return as a saint: an incarnation of that god's power and will made tangible. When the faithful cry out to their gods, it is the saints who answer. This might not be true in your world, but if you're playing at higher levels, you can get mileage out of this stat block regardless, as it can represent an avatar of divine fury or any being with a demigod's power.

The saint can utterly destroy most mortals with a wave of the hand, a quiet sigh, or a mere look. Only a party of the strongest characters from across the timescape could ever hope to stand against one, and even defeating a saint doesn't permanently destroy them.
It was Gaed who died at the hands of the devil spy. It was Saint Gaed the Confessor, now immortal, who returned and slew the devil.

monsterFluff.name: Samaapt
entries: As the Writer of Chaos, Samaapt focuses on creating the kind of shock that makes a good story irresistible. They speak with gravitas and the boisterous motion of a consummate thespian. Despite their cultivated intimidating appearance, Samaapt can win most over with a disarming smile and a welcoming gesture.

Samaapt rose to fame as a beloved celebrity prizefighter known for suspenseful matches, close calls, and dramatic victories. However, a fall from grace soon followed when they drunkenly revealed that they played down their skill to make bouts exciting and that their opponents were chosen for their lack of prowess so the tiefling could avoid danger. The story of Samaapt's deception spread overnight. They were an outcast, spat on in the streets and unable to draw a crowd. Recognizing their skill for spontaneity and theatrics, the Scribes recruited them, making all the world their stage.
When the characters first encounter Samaapt, read or paraphrase the following:

This broad-shouldered tiefling sports evidence of a hundred battles on their skin, most of which is covered by jagged black armor with ornate red detailing. Wide, flat horns start at their hairline and curl overtop and around the sides of their head.

items.name: Overview
entries: An enthusiastic entertainer and passionate mentor

items.name: Phrase
entries: "Give me a bloody good show."

items.name: Traits
entries: Engaging, boisterous, impulsive

items.name: Motivation
entries: While they seem content mentoring Scribes in the ways of improvisation and theatrics for storytelling, Samaapt secretly seeks a conversion that will allow them to sacrifice themself in the ultimate blaze of glory and win back the public adulation they lost.

monsterFluff.name: Sere'dina Elsys
entries: As the Writer of the Cracked Crown, Sere'dina Elsys ensures conversions cause transformation in her targets.

Sere'dina was one of the greatest military advisors of her time, serving a warlord named Corym Nevermour. She organized countless bloodbaths, caring for little more than winning and disregarding the communities destroyed by her e.orts. But every victory left her feeling hollow. An unseen force began souring her operations with incredibly implausible twists of fate, leading to Corym calling her skills into question. So she laid a trap and caught a team of Scribe operatives interfering in her war. Though she initially wanted to prove that others were responsible for her failures, the intrigue of the Scribes, the opportunity they presented to use her political and tactical mind, and the mundanity of Corym's military campaign swayed her to join the Scribes instead.
When the characters first encounter Sere'dina, read or paraphrase the following boxed text:
A tall elven woman with a supercilious expression and flowing golden hair wears dusky brown traveler's clothes with leather armor covering her shins, forearms, and shoulders.

items.name: Overview
entries: A ruthlessly logical and efficient strategist

items.name: Phrase
entries: "Make me care about it."

items.name: Traits
entries: Rational, pretentious, brooding

items.name: Motivation
entries: As the greatest strategist of her time, Sere'dina believes she is best suited to see the long-term impact of conversions and decide how the Scribes' actions will shape society. She's been in the role for nearly 600 years, but despite her desire to continue the work forever, the elf's life is nearing its end. Sere'dina knows that she needs to choose a successor, but so far she has found no one worthy of the role.

monsterFluff.name: Shieldbearer Adept
entries: Retainers are unique NPC followers who pledge their service to player characters. The following stat block presents a fighter retainer who uses their shield to attack and defend.
The {@book full rules for retainers|SaF|8|Retainers} can be found in {@loader Strongholds & Followers|collection/MCDM Productions; Strongholds and Followers.json}.

monsterFluff.name: The Librarian
entries: Read or paraphrase the following text to introduce the Librarian:

A wrinkled, frail woman with billowing grey hair stands among piles of disorganized tomes. Her elegant purple robes glimmer with gold embellishments along the skirt, buttons, and collar. She holds a large open book in one hand, and faint gold lettering dances on the surface of her skin.

entries.name: Roleplaying Notes
entries: You can use the following notes to help roleplay the Librarian.

entries.name: Overview
entries: An aloof professional whose storytelling is more an inherent need than a chosen vocation

entries.name: Phrase
entries: "Those who tell the stories rule society."

entries.name: Traits
entries: Oscillating temperament, curious, enigmatic

entries.name: Motivation
entries: The Librarian's greatest desire is to fill everything she reads with action, drama, and stronger plotlines than "Jard the guard made his fourteenth uneventful lap around the castle."

If presented with the opportunity, the Librarian may take revenge on her captors, but she doesn't actively seek retribution. She has relegated herself to the Vault and has found purpose in the Scribes.

entries.name: GM Tip: A Different Librarian
entries: The roleplay details of the Librarian are provided in case you want to use her as an interactive character. Alternatively, she could be a mysterious figure who never leaves her books, contemplating aloud what she'd like to see in a particular story while the Writers convert the musings into conversions. The Writers could also have agendas that influence those interpretations, adding intrigue to your game.

monsterFluff.name: Writer
entries: Though the Librarian isn't a deity, the Writers worship her with fervor and zeal. Each Writer also oversees a discipline within the Scribes. The disciplines are based on storytelling themes: action, drama, and plot. The plot-themed discipline is the Fallen Eye, the action-themed discipline is Chaos, and the drama-themed discipline is the Cracked Crown. The disciplines are not kept apart and it is rare to have a mission with operatives from only one discipline. They need each other, and the Writers encourage that.

entries.name: How dare they
entries: There has been only one group of Writers, the Forsaken, who tried to take conversions into their own hands. Remnants of texts from their time tell of a demon persuading them to release the Librarian, while other texts claim a Writer tried to overthrow the Celestial. While it is unlikely any of the Forsaken are still alive, the Writers are always alert for signs of them and other rogue operatives. If an operative questions the organization's purpose, they are removed from the Scribes. The typical procedure for removing an operative is a modify memory spell followed by abandonment on the Material Plane to live an unremarkable life, but the Writers have been known to get creative.

legendaryGroup.name: Polymath
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the polymath can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the polymath can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items: The polymath activates powerful magnets in the lair's roof, attracting metal equipment and objects in a 10-foot radius cylinder, extending from the floor to the ceiling, centered on a point the polymath can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, any metal weapon or object held by the target is wrenched out of their grasp and attaches to the ceiling. Additionally, if the target is wearing medium or heavy armor made of metal, they fall upward, taking fall damage as they would during a downward fall when they strike the ceiling, and become restrained. Affected objects and creatures fall back down at the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

Arrows fire from hidden traps in the walls, targeting three creatures of the polymath's choice within 60 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

A 5-foot-wide, 10-foot-tall hidden door opens in one of the lair's walls at a point of the polymath's choice. If the polymath is within 5 feet of the opening when it appears, they can move up to their speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} through the opening as part of this lair action, and the door closes behind them. If the polymath isn't within 5 feet of the opening when it appears, {@dice 1d4 + 1} {@creature mercenary|Ar18|mercenaries}{@sup {@cite Arcadia 18|Ar20|2}} or {@creature veteran|MM|veterans} loyal to the polymath enter the room, acting on initiative count 20 each round after the polymath takes a lair action.

variantrule.name: Optional Rule: Missed the Mark
entries: If your group enjoys having meaningful effects on "critical failures," you can add the following rule to the {@subclassFeature Shield Toss|Fighter|PHB|Shieldbearer|Ar20|7|Ar20} feature: if you roll a 1 on a ranged attack roll using a shield, the shield doesn't return to you, but instead lands harmlessly in your target's space.

variantrule.name: Shield Rules Tips
entries: The following tips clarify possible questions and oer suggestions for using your shield creatively.

entries.name: Attacking with a Shield in the Core Rules
entries: Even if they aren't a Shieldbearer, anyone can use their shield as an improvised melee weapon. But while they can technically attack with it, they don't add their proficiency bonus to the attack roll, and it only deals only {@damage 1d4} damage. Shieldbearers, on the other hand, are proficient with attacking with a shield and can deal more damage with it.

entries.name: Two Shields at Once
entries: If you want to use shields and only shields, you can absolutely dual-wield two shields at once. However, you only gain one shield's bonus to AC, since bonuses from the same source (i.e., a shield) don't stack.

entries.name: Bouncing Off the Walls
entries: Using your shield to ricochet between multiple targets is great fun, and so is bouncing a thrown shield off the environment. Even when you make a normal attack you can describe your shield rebounding off a pillar to hit a monster in the head for some awesome flavor. But at your GM's discretion, you might also use the environment to perform unusual moves. For example, your GM might let you bounce your shield around a corner to attack a target with total cover as if it had half or no cover, or throw your shield at a metal staircase to create a loud diversion. GMs are encouraged to lean toward the "rule of cool" and reward creativity when adjudicating such situations.

entries.name: Shield Surfing
entries: MCDM is not liable for any damage to your character or their equipment that results from using a shield to surf on any organic or inorganic surface. While we cannot offcially endorse such an activity, a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check would theoretically be appropriate in such a circumstance. Also, our playtesters agree that shield surfing down a snowy mountain is "wicked cool" and shield surfing on a lava river is "inadvisable, but certainly memorable for the survivors."

table.name: Scribe Rank Benefits
rows: Free nonmagical armor and weapons worth 10 gp or less
Free nonmagical armor and weapons worth 50 gp or less
Choice of a {@item deck of illusions}, an {@item immovable rod}, or {@item boots of striding and springing}
Choice of a {@item cloak of elvenkind}, {@item eyes of charming}, or a {@item hat of disguise}
Choice of {@item boots of elvenkind}, a {@item broom of flying}, or a {@item medallion of thoughts}
Free nonmagical adventuring gear worth 100 gp or less and free nonmagical armor or weapons of any price
Choice of a {@item portable hole}, a {@item ring of free action}, or {@item slippers of spider climbing}
Choice of {@item dimensional shackles}, a {@item helm of teleportation}, or a {@item rope of entanglement}
Choice of a {@item cape of the mountebank}, a {@item cube of force}, or a {@item gem of seeing}
Individual private quarters in the balcony area

The operative gains proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} skill and the choice of {@item Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments|DMG|marvelous pigments}, an {@item oathbow}, or a {@item ring of shooting stars}.

The operative gains proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Persuasion} skill and the choice of a {@item ring of telekinesis}, a {@item robe of scintillating colors}, or a {@item rod of security}.
The operative gains proficiency in the {@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception} skill and the choice of a {@item carpet of flying}, a {@item crystal ball}, or a {@item rod of alertness}.
footnotes: *An operative who already has proficiency in both skills offered at this rank can choose a different skill at the GM's discretion.

table.name: Story Suggestions
rows: A merchant was beset by goblins but saved by adventurers, and now wishes to gain skills to protect themself against future attacks.
An adventurer is embroiled in a quest to topple a pirate captain and their ruthless regime.
After missing a day of work, an accomplished miner returns to find their colleagues missing and a notebook filled with scrawlings of eyes in their place.
An accordion player in a traveling band comes across a rejuvenating pendant. Each band member covets the item.
A being made of wood gains sentience and seeks answers as to why they exist.
A demonic rift whispers promises of power to a homesteader in the woods. They wrestle between telling others of its existence or giving in to temptation.
A renegade wizard wants to make the {@spell magic missile} spell accessible to everyone, while nobles who wish to keep magic restricted try to root the mage out of hiding.

An experienced hunter on a routine expedition is attacked by a slimy, gasping Humanoid wielding a sharp hunk of metal. As the hunter flees back to town, they see unfamiliar sets of eyes watching them from the trees.
An annual mountainside hog ride is about to begin, but a track scout just discovered kobolds pouring out of a cave halfway through the run.
A naive goblin accidentally alerted an elf to the presence of their community. The goblin is now trying to catch the elf and beg them to stay quiet before the elf reaches their home.
A haunted drifter settles into the corner of a tavern after a long journey, only to have the spirits that plague them bring psychic torment to the other patrons.
Dwarf explorers unknowingly tarnished a forest occupied by wood elves. To salvage their reputation, the dwarves must survive the Gauntlet of Groves, a deadly elven contest of strength and will.
